Detailed Description

This is the actor class for Dynamic Rigid Objects.

This class should be used to make any rigid object that can be moved as a result of force. Most objects will fall into this catagory. A few examples of a Rigid Object: Boxes, Car Frames, Chairs, etc. For Semi Rigid bodies that are deformable, like jello, it is better to use ActorDynSoft.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ActorDynRigid::ActorDynRigid ( PhysReal  mass,
PhysString  name,
PhysString  file,
PhysString  group,
PhysWorld *  World 
)

Descriptive constructor.

This constructor contains the basic information needed to make a Rigid Object.
This class inherits from ActorBase.

Parameters:
Mass The mass the object will have in the PhysWorld.
Name The name of the actor.
File The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
Group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.
World Pointer to the PhysWorld this object will be added to.

btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld *  World 
) [protected, virtual]

Adds the actor to the physics world.

Adds the actor to the physics world.
This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
TargetWorld Pointer to the PhysWorld class.
World Pointer to the physics world.

Implements ActorBase.

void ActorDynRigid::CreateRigidObject ( PhysReal  pmass  )  [protected]

Creates a rigid object for the actor.

Creates a rigid object to be placed in the physics world later.
This is automaticly called by the Constructor and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
PMass "PhysReal Mass" The mass of the object.

Definition at line 279 of file physactor.cpp.

void ActorDynRigid::CreateShapeFromMesh (  ) 

Creates a collision shape from mesh file.

This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.

Definition at line 303 of file physactor.cpp.

void ActorDynRigid::SetBulletLocation ( PhysVector3  Location  )  [protected, virtual]

Sets the location of the physics body.

This will take a PhysVector3 and set the location of the actor within the physics world.
This function is called on by the SetLocation function, and shouldn't be called manually.

Reimplemented from ActorBase.

Definition at line 291 of file physactor.cpp.

void ActorDynRigid::SetBulletOrientation ( PhysQuaternion  Rotation  )  [protected, virtual]

Sets the orientation of the physics body.

This will take a PhysQuaternion and set the orientation of the actor within the physics world.
This function is called on by the SetOrientation function, and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
Rotation The quaternion representing the rotation of the actor.

Reimplemented from ActorBase.
